ygData.subject: Re: Operation Black Tower
ygData.msgSnippet: Night Shift looks to Tucson after hearing Cheetor cut out.  Not good.  What now? Tucson rumbles his engine a bit, signalling a hint of anger, yet controlled.

Night Shift looks to Tucson after hearing Cheetor cut out.

" Not good.  Wh=
at now?"

Tucson rumbles his engine a bit, signalling a hint of anger, yet =
controlled. He knew if he charged and gave into his emotions it would blow =
the entire operation out of the water.  He did not want to do that.  He thi=
nks for a moment.

" According to Cheetor, we have our work cut out for us.=
  We have a magma chamber around the fortress, temperature enhanced armor a=
round the tower of the complex, which to many of us who can not fly, will n=
ot be able to access easilly.  Talon, you can fly, thus you have a better c=
hance at reaching your destination than I do.  I think I need to reiterate =
this strategy a bit.  Talon, Wind Lord, if you can, try to fly Night Shift =
into the fortress as soon as he's found a route that gets you close enough =
to the fortress.  As soon as he is, he can gain access into the complex sti=
ll without being seen or heard.  But this may mean we have to find a way to=
 cloak your own signatures...  And you may be out of range of my sonar syst=
ems at that point..  Lord Elder, you will remain with me, I could use your =
imput to guide us and I need a driver obviously.."

Rat Trap raises a paw.
=

"Wheels, I think I got a better idea.  Instead of sending Night Shift, why=
 not send me instead?  I'm small enough and only one person has ta carry me=
 in.  No offense, Night Shift, but I am a lot lighter."

Night Shift nodds.=


"It's cool, no, it's a good idea.  Because if you can get in there before=
 me, you could probably disable the controls that alter the temperature of =
the fortress armor..  Yeah, that'll definitely work for all of us."

Tucson=
 turns to Night Shift.

"I have to admit, that is a good idea.  It pays to =
listen to comrades.  All right then, first, Windlord, if you could, carry R=
at Trap in the most safest possible route to the fortress, get him close en=
ough to the complex where he can be unseen and unheard.  From there he may =
be able to disable the software that controls the security system.  Percept=
or, you will be needed to keep Rat Trap updated, so he can navigate properl=
y." 

Rat Trap smiles as does Night Shift.

Tucson then turns to Rodimus.

=
" As originally planned, I will send word to you if things go awry. I have =
learned that now is not the time to go on personal crusades, but time to co=
llaborate with others to become a greater force."

He straigthens out his t=
railer, and positions himself at the exit door.

"All right, now is the tim=
e.  Phase two.  Windlord, Rat Trap, depart.  And good luck to you both."

R=
at Trap Nodds.

"Okay Windlord, ready when you are.  Geeze it feels good ta=
 be back in action again."

Tucson now turns to Kup and Straight Shot.

" S=
ince we've had to alter our plans somewhat, you will move in with Night Shi=
ft, as soon as Rat Trap is able to disable some of the security systems.  I=
t will make easier passage for all of you.  Night Shift will alert you to p=
ending danger, as is his finest attribute on the battle field.  Now, it's t=
ime to show Hydras what we're made of."

 I also plan to send a mild sonar wave which

code. I haven't tried doing that but I do know my

k around various codes and configure a buffer that 
> > will not harm anyon=
e who isn't under our signature. If at any time, you

n is not working, feel free to intervine".

on the task at hand as does his eyes and nose. He raises his head

> <NEW>
> 
> Rodimus nodded as he brought his console fully =
online. Screens lit up as 
> communication gear began to glow with readines=
s. "We will do what we can." 
> He said, his voice, despite his words, was =
full of confidence.
> 
> "Be careful." Lord Elder said, his voice, as alway=
s the voice of reason. "I 
> can send Rodimus to back you up if need be, bu=
t our sensors will not be able 
> to track you beyond a certain point. You =
will be on your own unless you call 
> us."
> 
> "But if you call, we will =
be ready." Rodimus said, the old enthusiasm 
> creeping back into his voice=
.
> 
> "Cheetor to base!" Cheetor's voice crackeled over the comm.-channel.=
 "I've 
> gotten here." He said, he was obviously out of breath from the tr=
avel.
> 
> Cheetor whisteled over the channel, "You should see what they've=
 done." 
> Cheetor is not equipped with cameras, but his voice continued, "=
The base 
> looks totally rebuilt, like some sort of fortified tower, encas=
ed in armor."
> 
> There is a pause, the sound of movement, probably Cheeto=
r, and then he 
> continued, "There is a small lake of magma here, and the =
tower is sitting in 
> the *middle* of it. If you can't fly, you are going =
to have trouble getting 
> to it." There was another pause, "From what my t=
hermal scanners tell me, the 
> surface of the tower is HOT, all that hot r=
ock sitting near it."
> 
> The sound of more movement, "Slag!" The sound of=
 movement, "I see one . . . 
> two . . . three?? Scourge's flying around he=
re." He sounded definitely 
> confused. "They seem to be patrolling." His v=
oice dropped to a whisper, "I'm 
> signing off, I think they can hear me . =
. ."
> 
> <Click> the line is shut off.
> 
> Lord Elder turned to look at T=
uscon as Rodimus stood up trying to reopen the 
> comm-channel, "Cheetor! C=
HEETOR!!!"
